items.title: Semaphore CI: Head of Marketing
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(europ, european, europeanunion)
items.content:
Head of Marketing

Company: Semaphore CI
Headquarters: Remote, Europe
https://semaphoreci.com/about/careers
At Semaphore CI.com we're building the next generation code delivery platform for developers and looking for our first Head of Marketing. The company is currently a ~25 person remote team distributed in 7 countries. We're bootstrapped, profitable and have a six-year track record of providing a product that customers love.

We’re looking to bring someone that has a proven track record of being part of a growing SaaS business. Someone who can spearhead strategy, hire, recruit and onboard a team, establish and scale processes, and take our marketing to the next level.

About us

Semaphore is used by thousands of tech companies across the globe, from startups to companies like Salesforce, Toyota and Uber. Our mission is to help developers move fast in their work. We do that by delivering a product that's fast and easy to use, backed by a highly rated customer service.

Our culture is built on optimizing for happiness, of our customers and ourselves. We operate on continuous improvement on a personal and collective level. When doing things, we prefer to get real and make something valuable sooner, rather than never. We treat each other and our customers with openness, respect and empathy.

You'll be responsible for:
  • Growing our team remotely and internationally
  • Expanding our brand
  • Expanding our marketing campaigns (our top market is the USA)
  • Expand our marketing efforts (content / social / paid / SEO / etc)
  • Set strategy and execute marketing campaigns
  • Set up KPIs and report to the founding team
  • Work closely with Product and Customer Success team to align all teams for growth


Requirements

  • 5+ years of B2B SaaS/Startup marketing experience
  • 2+ years of Director of Marketing experience
  • Strong leadership and people management skills
  • Proven track record of scaling marketing campaigns internationally
Because of time overlap with the team, we'll consider candidates based in Europe only.

Bonus points if you have experience:

  • In developer tools industry
  • With content marketing
  • Working remotely
  • With international markets (USA, UK, Germany, Canada, Australia)


BENEFITS

  • The impact of working on a product that's competing on a global market.
  • Join a small team of around 25 full-time people who love what they do.
  • A healthy 40-hour work week, a friendly and supportive work environment.
  • Competitive salary.
  • Company retreats.
  • Space to learn continuously and choose the tools and equipment for your job.
  • Paid trips to conferences and books of your choice.
  • Paid membership at a fitness club of your choice.

Semaphore is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with our mission of serving a diverse and global audience, we value a diverse workforce and inclusive culture which reflects that. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, marital status, disability, and veteran status.

Apply for this position

Please apply here: https://renderedtext.workable.com/jobs/726339/candidates/new

items.title: Director of Global Partners
items.content:
At GoCardless we’re looking to scale from processing nearly £5 billion a year to over £10 billion. Our vision is to build a global connected payments network, making payments simpler no matter what country you're in or what software you are using.

GoCardless is building the world’s first payment network for bank-to-bank payments, to rival credit and debit cards. Our mission is to break down barriers, so businesses can take payments directly from customers’ bank accounts, anywhere globally, in any currency.

To further help us achieve this goal, we’re looking for a talented internationally experienced leader who will be responsible for building and rapidly growing GoCardless’ Partner Revenues globally through our rapidly growing Partner network.

In this new role, you will build a partner organisation based on International software vendors covering both SMB (eg Xero) and Global Enterprise (eg Zuora) as well as over 150 ‘local’ partners based in a specific territories. These organisations have, and will continue to have, significant impact on GoCardless’ revenues.

You will also be responsible for developing existing Partnerships whilst identifying both global and localised technology partners. Working with them to build joint GTM strategies and to deliver revenue.

You will manage and develop a team of Partner Development, Success, Marketing and Sales individuals to work through technology partners globally. Your team will initially span London and Paris with the potential growth across other territories such as Germany, Australia and USA.

As a Leader and part of our Sales Leadership Team we look for the courage and confidence to challenge the status quo; anticipating problems and mitigating risks.

*Who we’re looking for*

* Experience having led a fast growing International Partner Team for a Saas Software Company
* Built new revenue streams through a partner network globally
* Developed and led a portfolio of Global Partnerships which deliver fast growing revenue in multiple countries across Europe, North America and APAC
* Previously executed joint Go-to-Market strategies, regionally, locally (i.e. in country) and globally
* Attention to detail, and the ability to negotiate complex contracts with Partners.
* Comfortable managing remote Business Development, Marketing and Sales individuals - based in other countries or continents
* Strategic view of the business and experience of working at the Executive Board level cross functionally across the business to execute joint goals and plans
* Grown a significantly sized multi-country team of professionals
* Excellent presentation, interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written.
* A key decision Maker: you have excellent decision-making, analytical and problem solving skills, assessing the relative importance of activities and assignments and adjusting priorities when appropriate
* A Culture builder: You have motivation and flexibility to work well in a rapidly changing and fast-growing environment

Our team comes from a variety of backgrounds and we embrace diversity – if you’re unsure, please apply

DIRECT CLIENT REQUIREMENT, Greensboro,NC- Remote option available.

Role: project manager

Digipulse Technologies, Inc (DTI) is a software solutions company offering focused IT services to fortune 1000 clients. We provide services in enterprise application development, system integration & support services for Insurance, Financial, Hospitality, Telecommunication, Pharmaceutical & Banking sectors.

Job description:

As the Project Specialist, you will assist in project execution. You are responsible for providing project management support to one or more Project Managers and/or may be responsible for leading projects. Partner with Project Managers to gather estimates, then build and maintain the project schedule in appropriate schedule management tool. Provide resource management support by updating project resource allocations and milestones within the project schedule based on feedback from the Project Manager and/or Resource Managers. Create agendas for meetings, document issues, actions and decisions from meetings, and publish meeting minutes. Create presentation materials for project kick off, status and steering committee meetings. Assist in the collection, recording, tracking and analysis of project effort and financial information.

Education o 4 Year/Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience (4 years of experience in lieu of Bachelor's) (Minimum Required)

Experience o 1-3+ Years of experience in Project Management preferred.

Education : Master's Degree in Engineering (Electronic/ Electrical/Civil/Mechanical), Computer Science, Applications, Computer Information Technology. Alternatively will accept Bachelor's Degree in Engineering (Electronic/ Electrical/Civil/Mechanical), Computer Science, Applications, Computer Information Technology followed by 5 years of progressive experience. Will accept Foreign Educational Equivalent.

If interested, Please reply with your Daytime contact number, Salary rate and Work Authorization on shilpa(at)digipulsetech(dot)com or call on

Thanks & Regards

items.title: Head of People Operations

items.content:
Head of People Operations


Acuity Scheduling, Inc.

Hi there,

I'm Gavin, founder and CEO at Acuity Scheduling.

I’m proud to say we’ve been helping small businesses manage their appointments for 11 years now. In that time, we’ve grown. What started with me pecking away at a keyboard all by my lonesome has turned into a company with nearly 40 employees scattered around the globe. And we’re continuing to grow at a healthy pace.

But I need your help.

We've been able to build a completely remote company with a phenomenal culture and happy employees. And I want Acuity to stay that way. It is deeply important to me that our people are happy — more important to me than just raking in profits. But people aren't my forte. And, as we grow, I'm being pulled in many different directions. So we need someone like you to work full-time to maintain our happiness.

Can you help us to continue to grow and to enjoy our jobs more?

**REQUIREMENTS**

Here's some of what you'll be expected to do:

* Think of new ways to delight remote employees
* Oversee our benefits and manage them in conjunction with Justworks (our PEO)
* Help ensure job postings and interviews are fair and inclusive
* Make sure new employees feel supported even before they start
* Work with other folks to organize company retreats
* Find ways to keep the pulse of employee morale
* Keep me informed of issues so we can solve them together
* You're all about ethics, and you want to be sure we're always on the right side of employment laws


Experience in these areas will help:

* You've helped other managers get better at their jobs
* You know your way around insurance (PPO, HMO, and POS are more than just letters slurped from your alphabet soup)
* Extending job offers is something you can do in your sleep
* You've helped terminate enough people to know how painful it can be, as well as what to do in advance to avoid surprises

**BENEFITS**

And by the way? These other qualities would probably help bucketsful:

* You’re in favor of having 100% of your medical, dental, and vision premiums covered.
* 401K is your middle name. (Or if you just really like the idea of having 3% of your salary contributed to one.)
* You’re an autodidact. Go on. Look it up. (You’ll get a $5,000 credit toward continuing your education.)

If this description sounds like you, there’s a chance that I’d like to offer you $80k-$115k, straight-up cash money. I mean, it’d be in exchange for your professional services each year, but still.

Write me. Or, you know, fill out the application that I will review personally.

cheers,

-Gavin

Location: United States

See more jobs at Acuity Scheduling, Inc.

items.title: Head of Social Media and News
tags: DBG:surround``OR(pacif, pst, pdt, western, california, losangel, sanfrancisco, paloalto, sanmateo) 3W OR(time,timezon)
DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
items.content:
Head of Social Media and News

Marketing
Pacific Time Zone
Company: Product Hunt
Full Time

Overview

We love products, care about people, and thirst to build a community that celebrates making. Our distributed, tight-knit team is headquartered in SF.

In 2016, Product Hunt was acquired by AngelList and continues to operate as an independent team, helping surface new products from makers across the world.

Nowadays talent is distributed worldwide and everyone can learn online all skills required to build amazing products, what most people outside of strong startup hubs lack though is exposure to early adopters and supporters. We want to help makers worldwide to reach an audience, connect with others, and become successful.

Product Hunt is based in San Francisco, operating as a distributed team across 9 timezones. This full-time role is available for remote candidates from anywhere in the world, but you’ll need to be available from (the rest of your hours can be worked flexibly at your convenience).

5:30am-noon PT Monday-Friday

Your primary daily responsibility will include managing Product Hunt’s Twitter, Facebook, and other social channels, and covering breaking tech news for our news app, Sip ().

http://sip.fyi

—

RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE

– Writing superpowers. Every day, dozens of makers launch on Product Hunt. As the main owner of our social media profiles (Twitter and Facebook) and our editorial voice inside Sip, you’ll need to love crafting interesting and intriguing tweets, posts, and editorial takes to help makers put their best foot forward and drive traffic to their product.

– Love for all things tech. New product launches, features, and startups are your bread and butter. If you find yourself spending hours on Twitter, following individuals and teams build incredible products, this is your jam. No joke is too niche for you.

– Attention to detail. An extreme attentiveness to detail and organization is important. You should enjoy editing blog posts for friends and fixing even the most minor grammatical errors.

– Data-driven attitude. We’re constantly optimizing our content and running experiments based on past successes (and failures!). You love to design and execute growth initiatives independently.

If this list (without exceptions) gets you pumped, we want to hear from you.

HOW TO APPLY

If this role sounds exciting and you’re able to meet the time commitment (we welcome people outside the US!), please follow these steps:

First, apply via AngelList .

here

Second, send  your answers to the following:

talent@producthunt.com
  1. Why do you want to join the Product Hunt team for this specific role? What makes it a good fit?
  2. What’s the favorite product you’ve recently discovered?
  3. Who are your favorite content producers? Blogs, podcasts, etc. all work.
  4. What’s your Product Hunt username and Twitter handle?
  5. Most importantly, what’s your favorite emoji?

    6. To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://angel.co/product-hunt/jobs/325616-head-of-social-media-and-news →

items.title: Managing Director of Communications
items.content:
Managing Director of Communications

Various
US East Coast
Company: Change.org
Full Time

Overview

Change.org is the world’s largest technology platform for social change. Our team spans 18 countries and empowers hundreds of millions of people to win the change they want to see.

Change.org users have convinced giant corporations like Starbucks to invest in better cups to protect our environment; pushed Congress to pass the first ever Bill of Rights for sexual assault survivors; ended discriminatory policies in the Boy Scouts of America that kept LGBT people from serving as Scouts or Scout leaders; and secured the freedom of nearly 20 people serving life sentences in prison for nonviolent drug offenses, shaping a national conversation about inequities in the U.S. criminal justice system. As a social good business, we aim to build a world where creating change is a part of everyday life.

It’s deeply exciting work and a deeply exciting, meaningful time to be a part of it.

About the role

As Managing Director of Communications, you will be a senior leader in North America, and the company globally, responsible for building our brand by elevating the stories of our petitions, petition starters and users to mass media audiences across North America.

You’ll lead the North American communications team of 4-5 to amplify the stories of people using Change.org to make a difference. In other words, you’ll tell the story of Change.org while inspiring millions to believe in their own potential to alter the world around them. On any given day, you and your team might be negotiating with a Senator’s office, training petition starters on how to speak to the media, accompanying the CEO to a prime-time television taping, or handling high-level media relationships.

You’ll lead our brand strategy:
  • Turn the vision and big picture goals into an ambitious brand strategy to drive our national presence and media coverage telling the story of Change.org
  • Deepen brand affinity with our users, partners and potential users, creating a virtuous cycle where brand affinity drives petition creation and user engagement
  • Grow our social media reach and influence, and ensure all our channels are leveraged for impact on the campaigns started on the platform.

    • You’ll drive our communications and media campaigning:
    • Lead top-tier national media outreach on the grassroots campaigns that develop daily on Change.org, including leading your team to identify and pitch compelling campaign stories every day
    • Oversee media training and support to petition starters and your colleagues before and during media appearances and events
    • Collaborate  and coordinate with teams around the world on international campaigns and media opportunities.
    • Represent Change.org at important media meetings, events and interviews, both on- and off-the-record.

      • You’ll lead the communications team:
      • Hire, manage, coach, and lead a standout communications team in North America
      • Actively contribute to the North American leadership team of 5 across campaigns, communications, membership, and email staff. Together we’ll expand the team, run and win massive campaigns, and build our brand and revenue.
      • Work with vendors to ensure the team has effective and reliable databases, tools, and resources for public relations work.

        • About you:
        • , having worked for 8-10+ years engaging national and influential media that reach millions on a weekly basis
          • You’re an experienced communications professional
        • who lives for a well told story, believes deeply in its power to change the world and is uncommonly good at identifying and framing stories
          • You’re a story fiend
        • with a demonstrated ability to create a national and/or global brand presence for an organization
          • You’re a strategic brand-builder
        • , having effectively built and led high-performing teams
          • You’re an inspiring manager
        • , supportive and inclusive in your relationships with your team and colleagues, and comfortable working cooperatively in a fast-paced environment
          • You’re collaborative
        • and empowering people everywhere to make a difference in the world.
          • You’re passionate about Change.org’s mission of social change

          As a bonus, you might also have some of these skills or experiences:
          • building strategic relationships with national media producers, editors, bookers, influencers, and journalists
          • handling strategic and crisis communications, messaging, and brand management
          • living in or building relationships with communities that have faced disadvantage, discrimination or marginalization in North America
          • working in a digital/online environment, with colleagues who live far from you
          • working with leaders to build their profiles
          • building internal communications systems
          • working for a technology platform and/or an organization run on user-generated campaigns/content

            • This is a full-time role ideally based in New York, but we will also consider exceptional people based in Washington DC, or working remotely on East Coast US hours.

            We are a certified B corporation with generous benefits including unlimited vacation, 18 weeks fully paid parental leave, and health, vision and dental insurance. We’re enjoy our work, and working with each other.

            We’re committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. Our user base is wonderfully diverse, and we want our team to reflect that. We strongly encourage people of different backgrounds, cultures, genders, experiences, abilities and perspectives to apply. We will consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical disability, or length of time spent unemployed.

            We are working for a world where no one is powerless, and where creating change is a part of everyday life. Join us.

            To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://jobs.lever.co/change/e83ad132-6060-4f3c-9637-0f7aa99a4fae →

items.title: SAP Software Implementation Consultant - Warehouse Management - Remote
items.content:
Job Description

SAP Software Implementation Consultant - ERP/Warehouse Management Systems

Remote - can live anywhere in the Northeast

Description:

Within the Implementation team, the candidate will implement our ERP and Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) solutions which integrates to (SAP Business One, SAP ByDesign, SAP BI EDGE).

Top salary plus bonus and full benefits

Responsibilities: (Besides implementing our ERP and WMS systems)

  • Develop good relationships with our partners and travel to meet them on regular basis.
  • Understand our customers' needs and make value-added suggestions;
  • Perform detailed needs assessment and provide a demonstration to partners and clients, aligned completely with assessment;
  • Communicate with our Sales team and participate in making sure that clients are satisfied with the end results;
  • Understand and demonstrate our software products (WMS and other related and required software, and hardware).

Requirements :

  • Bachelor's degree
  • 5 to 7 years of Implementation or Consulting experience;
  • Experience with ERP or WMS;
  • Excellent human and interpersonal skills;
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills;

Nice to have requirements :

  • Knowledge of the processes of distribution and manufacturing companies (make to order, make to stock, project, etc.) and bar coding, scanning or other WMS technologies

About N'ware

N'ware Technologies, in business since 1995, with offices in the USA, Canada, and Latin America. N'ware Technologies specializes in Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Systems, Warehouse Management Systems (WMS), and E-Commerce. A Gold SAP partner in the Americas, N'ware's focus is on manufacturing and distribution companies, with a specialty in high-tech, consumer goods, medical devices, and DCAA compliance.

Company DescriptionClearView Recruiting is a company located in the US with a team of highly specialized recruitment professionals. Our team provides customized solutions for companies of all sizes to attract and locate quality talent for their open positions. We specialize in all types of industries and fields.

Enterprise SaaS Integration Project Manager at Victory

Remote

When we discuss work with our clients and candidates, we discover:

  • What success looks like for the person doing the work
  • The 3 skills deemed most applicable by the Victory and the manager
  • Any experiences Victory and the manager feel will be helpful to do the work

This process drives a streamlined and efficient effort to connect people with meaningful work. Feel free to take a look at our opportunity below and apply if you’d like to learn more.

The cool stuff:

  • The project is uncommon with the end client seeking zero on-prem IT. They are using technology and a vast array of SaaS applications to run the IT business for an Enterprise Financial Services company.
  • We are seeing more and more IT moving to the Cloud. By the time this project is completed that trend will have increased dramatically along with the market value of this person.
  • Remote work is accepted.

Past Experiences Preferred:

  • Previous experience “shepherding” SaaS partners into an Enterprise Public Cloud (platform is not specific…AWS, Azure, etc.).
  • A project-manager mentality with project leader communication ability
  • Previous PM experience with SaaS parnters (this is not a hands-on technical role)
  • Fortune 500 work working in a consulting role

Candidate areas of expertise required:

  • HIGHLY ARTICULATE Written and Verbal Communication Skills
  • Proficiency in working with SaaS partners
  • SSO experience

Geo Location of work:

*Remote – Occasional trips to NYC (Less than 25%)

If you like what you see and think you may be a fit, feel free to apply below and we review in further detail.

Thanks for reading!

Senior Technical Project Manager at Oracle

Remote

180012GP

Location: United States (Remote)

Job Type: Regular Employee Hire

We are unable to provide visa sponsorship for this role at this time – no candidates requiring visa sponsorship will be considered.

Company Description:

Oracle Hospitality the portfolio of Global Industry focused solutions that identify and deliver strategic cloud solutions in a timely, scalable, predictable, secure manner – decreasing cost and increasing flexibility to absorb acquisitions, capitalize on new opportunities and hit aggressive business revenue targets. Join the Oracle Hospitality Business Unit as a Principal Technical Program Manager to leverage technology and value added processes and tools to provide project portfolio management, resource management, best practices and process, analysis and reporting, and knowledge sharing.

Job Description:

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Plan and deliver managed services projects consistently on-time and on-budget
  • Effectively manage project scope, timelines, budgets and customer expectations
  • Provide project leadership through all phases of the project lifecycle
  • Determine resource needs and communicate requests for personnel
  • Anticipate and proactively remediate project issues internally and with customers
  • Partner with Cloud Operations to ensure a successful transition from delivery to day two operations
  • Strive to consistently improve customer satisfaction, delivery times and service levels while reducing costs
  • Excel at planning, execution and communication
  • Create and contribute to an environment that is geared to innovation, high productivity, high quality and customer service
  • Assist Sales teams in customer facing environments promoting Oracle products and services

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor’s degree in a business or computer related field 3+ years related experience in a best-in-class project management organization
  • Successfully completed multiple infrastructure and managed application deliveries
  • Successfully managed Oracle Opera installations and version upgrades, Oracle Food & Beverage and retail application installations
  • Must have a broad, strong technical knowledge which encompasses Datacenter technologies including hardware & design, LAN/WAN Networking, Database, Platform and application.
  • Experience utilizing enterprise project management tools such as Primavera
  • Comfortable discussing technical concepts with business people and business concepts with technical people. Able to express complex concepts in plain language to reach broader audiences.
  • Must be an exceptional communicator and comfortable in presenting both in public and online to business and technical executives
  • Ability to succeed through collaboration and working through other internal and external organizations and individuals (a track record of delivering results within a matrix business environment)
  • Strong leadership capabilities and strong interpersonal skills required
  • Ability to learn quickly and adjust to changing priorities while maintaining a positive, can-do attitude
  • Sets high standards with respect to the treatment of customers and peers
  • ITIL Certification
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification is a plus

Detailed Description and Job Requirements

  • Coordinates all aspects of internal information system-specific projects from initiation to delivery.
  • Projects often involve network, server, or software implementation and upgrades, PC deployment and the like.
  • Coordinates work performed by IT staff and internal customers/partners by defining project specifications, performing feasibility and needs/impact assessments.
  • Develops detailed project plans and manages all implementation processes including resource allocation, progress tracking, monitoring change control process, testing, documentation, training and on-time delivery within budget constraints.
  • Duties and tasks are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment.
  • Fully competent in own area of expertise.
  • May have project lead role and or supervise lower level personnel.
  • BS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area.
  • Typically 5 years of project management, product design or related experience needed.

items.title: Director of Human Resources
items.content:
Director of Human Resources at Peerfit

Remote

Director of Human Resources

  • Human Resources
  • United States

Peerfit

Interested in working for a team of people completely redefining how fitness and health care work together? At Peerfit, we’re flipping wellness reimbursements on their head by connecting insurers’ and employers’ wellness dollars to popular fitness studios offering CrossFit, yoga, barre, boot camp, cycling, and more. If working with a team of innovative and driven people who are modernizing how people engage with wellness excites you, look no further than Peerfit.

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Director of Human Resources plans, directs, and coordinates all talent acquisition, talent management and human resource management activities. These activities will include overseeing the coordination of recruitment, compliance, personnel policies, compensation, benefits, performance management and employee relations activities to maximize our employees success.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Serve as primary point of contact for all employees for human resources policies, procedures and matters of concern
  • Conduct new employee orientations and ensure all paperwork and files for new hires are processed and stored according to protocol
  • Conduct exit interviews and handle process for separating with employees
  • Create reports and analyze data which may include turnover, exit survey responses, and headcount reports
  • Assist with coordination and execution of year end activities including promotions, compensation statements and performance reviews
  • Ensure legal and contractual compliance by monitoring and implementing applicable HR laws and regulations by location (federal, state, local)
  • Support the payroll process by providing accurate and timely updated salary, bonus and benefits information to accounting
  • Manage benefits administration and manage benefits enrollment process each year
  • Leads hiring process through talent acquisition/applicant tracking tool including posting jobs, reviewing resumes, screening and interviewing candidates and background checks with third party administrator
  • Partner with hiring managers to ensure a smooth recruiting and onboarding process
  • Maintain various reports/metrics for candidate referral sources, posting sites/resources, recruiting expenses
  • Lead quarterly performance management process to include; project management, administration of our performance management software, answering questions, train employees, and development of education and tools
  • Assist with scheduling, materials development and coordination of all training and development projects
  • Assist with compiling talent management reports and talent analytics
  • Lead special projects, as assigned

EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONS:

  • 5 years of experience in progressive human resources required
  • 5 years experience with recruitment and talent management required
  • Outstanding ability to coordinate and perform both routine and complex administrative duties with strong attention to detail
  • Excellent project and stakeholder management skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Demonstrated ability to earn trust and appropriately handle confidential and sensitive information
  • High level of energy and the ability to work well with all across the organization
  • Ability to multi-task and be highly proactive around all functions of human resources, talent acquisition and talent management initiatives
  • Expert MS Office and/or GSuite productivity tools, experience with applicant tracking software, and strong technical/computer skills
  • Superior grammar, editing and proofreading skills
  • Strong professionalism, diplomacy, composure and flexibility
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

NICE TO HAVES:

  • Technology recruitment experience is a huge plus
  • Experience in a high growth start-up
  • Administration and experience with applicant tracking systems such as Google Hire
  • Administration and experience with HRIS technologies such as Namely
  • Experience with various job boards and niche hiring sites
  • Remote working experience

EDUCATIONAL GUIDELINES:

  • Bachelor’s degree required
  • Professional in Human Resources (PHR or SPHR) preferred

WHO WE NEED: (Intangibles)

  • Passionate about health and fitness
  • Desires to have a role in the growth of a startup
  • Stays motivated and knows how to be persistent
  • Is self-directed
  • Can work remotely and make decisions autonomously at a high level
  • Flexibility to handle changing responsibilities

WHAT YOU GET:

  • The opportunity to help expand the impact of Peerfit across the United Statesand, someday, the world!
  • The chance to work in a relaxed, yet goal-driven start-up culture with a passion for fitness
  • Peerfit credits to attend fitness classes.
  • Chance to work remotely with flexible scheduling
  • Health Insurance & other benefits

Peerfit is an AA/Equal Opportunity Employer

Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans

items.title: Maître: Head of Growth
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=16, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=2, frontend=0}
items.content:
Head of Growth

Company: Maître
Headquarters: London
https://maitreapp.co
⭐️ What is Maître?
Maître a leading company in the referral marketing space. We provide simple tools that allow companies to embed referral programs of any type (think refer-a-friend contests, giveaways, milestone programs, etc) on their own website. Our tools are used or seen everyday by tens of thousands of people around the world.

Our mission is to help companies acquire new customers in a scalable, cheap and sustainable way by scaling and automating their word-of-mouth.

We are a 2.5 years old company and since our launch we have hit several milestones: over 1,500 customers, top 50 most upvoted products of all time on Product Hunt, over 25M (that's millions) leads generated for our customers. We are a bootstrapped company that has been profitable from day 1.

The Team and how we work
The Maître team works remotely, from various places around the world and our ability to work depends solely on having a laptop and access to wifi.

We use a range of tools including Twist, Notion, Google Drive and Skype to enable us to communicate, plan and share information with each other. We take responsibility for our roles and so long as the work is getting done and progress is being made, the time we work is flexible.

This means: we will never count the hours you work!

We believe smart people manage themselves and don't need to be micromanaged. If you are a smart person, we want to talk to you!

Role & Responsibilities
We are looking for an amazing Head of Growth; somebody who can take our user-acquisition game to the next level and has a track record for designing and building user-acquisition machines.

In the day-to-day, your responsibilities will be:
  • Work hands-on to design implement highly converting marketing funnels, landing pages, copy, etc.
  • Run tests, get feedback from users and colleagues, crunch the numbers, and iterate fast
  • Plan and execute our content marketing strategy
  • Hit our aggressive user and revenue targets

You won't do...
  • Coding
  • Financials
  • Customer support (unless you want to)
  • Cold calling

❤️ Why you’ll love it
  • You’ll take over responsibility and ownership of your projects from day one.
  • You can work from anywhere in the world. You also don’t need to report on hours worked.
  • You’ll enjoy the freedom to organize yourself the way you want and work with whichever tools you love.
  • You’ll work directly with the CEO
  • We use A LOT of emojis
 
The perfect candidate...
  • Has a proven track record of growing users, customers or sales
  • Is confident working independently, and doesn’t want to or need to be micromanaged
  • Is familiar with several marketing channels and knows how to set up experiments for each of them
  • Is self-motivated
  • Is full of energy and fresh ideas (no idea is a stupid idea)
  • In possession of own laptop/computer and access to wifi
  • Has worked remotely in the past and likes the remote style of work
  • Is a GREAT communicator. Most of the communication will happen asynchronously and via text so being concise and straightforward is of primary importance
  • Is a native English speaker or has an exceptionally good English

Hours and Pay
We are offering a part-time role for 2 to 4 days a week.

As said before, we won't be micromanaging you and your success with us will be judged on the work  you produce. Compensation will be discussed on the call.

Are you the right person?
If you think you are up to the task, apply below.

DO NOT SEND YOUR CV

We don't care about your CV.
Instead, send us a short letter (1-page max) where you tell us:
  • who you are
  • what your motivations are
  • Your track-record and where you have added value in the past
  • WHY we should hire you

We are looking forward to receiving your application

Apply for this position

Send your application to manuel@maitreapp.co

items.content:
Job Description

ValuD Consulting is currently looking for several Full-Time Remote Project Managers who have heavy Agile experience!

To be considered for this role, you must be able to travel heavily within the U.S and globally.

Responsibilities

Successful candidates will have experience managing large / medium IBM TRIRIGA projects and maintaining all aspects of Project plans including:

  • Timeline management
  • Issue Resolution and escalation
  • Communications & status reporting
  • Vendor Management
  • Risk Management
  • Stakeholder Management
  • Resource Management
  • Deliverable Management
  • Scope Management
  • Demonstrated ability to focus on several different projects while still maintaining attention to detail
  • Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, task and workflow analyses.
  • Utilize project management skills to ensure successful software release process, including development and execution of project plans and ensuring internal organizational readiness. This requires the ability to effectively communicate (verbally and in writing) with all levels of the organization.
  • Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.
  • Help translate product specifications and business processes between clients and internal technical team
  • Be the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams. Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously
  • Ensure that issues and action items are identified, tracked, reported on, and resolved in a timely manner
  • Support user acceptance testing processes to ensure that product requirements are fully satisfied
  • Work with internal stakeholders to execute project plans while developing best practices to facilitate high-quality software releases
  • Other duties as required

Job Qualifications

  • Experience with IBM TRIRIGA preferred however experience with other enterprise-class IWMS programs may be considered such as Manhattan, CenterStone, Archibus, eBuilder, Planon, Accruent and Lucernix
  • Must have heavy Agile experience in order to be considered
  • Experience or understanding of real estate, facilities management, maintenance and operations, capitol projects and condition assessments preferred
  • Extreme attention to detail and top organizational skills
  • Strong communication skills
  • Solid technical knowledge / aptitude
  • Experience working within IWMS products or within the Real Estate and Facilities Management industries preferred
  • Experience working as a Project Manager in a professional services organization for a growing software company
  • PMP or SCRUM Certifications a major plus
  • Preferred Experience: 2-5 years of experience with IBM Tririga
  • Preferred Education: B.S. or B.A. in a related discipline
  • Must be able to travel nationally and globally on a regular basis

Company DescriptionValuD, a Gold Accredited IBM Business Partner, delivers real estate, asset and facilities management solutions that solve business problems. Founded in 2009 by Gopi Latpate, an original architect of TRIRIGA, ValuD has the largest and most experienced team focused exclusively on IBM TRIRIGA and Maximo. ValuD is the 'go to' IBM partner for implementations, upgrades, training and support for TRIRIGA and Maximo. On the INC 5000 list three years in a row, ValuD has successfully completed more than 180 projects, improving real estate, asset and facilities management for companies of all sizes. The dedicated Lease Accounting practice has implemented more FASB compliance projects than any other firm in the world. With over 240 employees, the company is headquartered in Dallas, TX, with a virtual US team and an office in India.

items.title: Cloud Solutions Executive - Remote
items.content:
Job Description

The Business Solutions Cloud Sales Executive would focus the majority of their prospecting and sales activities on companies and opportunities that would benefit from phoenixNAP Cloud Services. This sales professional will be the most experienced team member on virtualized computing products, storage and distributed applications.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities

• Prospect and identify opportunities focused around phoenixNAP Cloud Solutions.

• Educate and assist prospects and understanding phoenixNAP Cloud Solutions and how they will integrate into the prospects current environment and future IT plans.

• Work with Sales Engineering to make sure prospects specific needs regarding cloud environments are met and optimized with phoenixNAP Cloud Solutions products.

• Provide prospects with detailed quotes regarding cloud opportunities and work with sales engineering to make sure clients' specific needs are being addressed.

• Follow up with any cloud opportunities that have been presented by the Sales Executive on a timely and consistent basis.

• Find and identify other sales opportunities around phoenixNAP products including Colocation, Hardware as a Service (HaaS), Bandwidth, Backup, DRaaS and other phoenixNAP products.

• Use Salesforce CRM software to set up prospects and leads, quote specific phoenixNAP products and follow up with any and all opportunities.

• Work with Channel Partners on large or complex phoenixNAP cloud opportunities to evaluate prospect needs, produce and provide quotes and work with Channel Partner on any communications with prospects.

• Educate specific channel partners on phoenixNAP cloud products including how to identify opportunities, provide education to prospects and partners regarding cloud products and offer case studies and best use practices regarding products.

• Work with Sales Leadership at phoenixNAP on state of pipeline, opportunities and other sales information.

• Provide detailed reports at the request of the sales director regarding leads, opportunities and active pipeline probability.

• Provide assistance upon request to other members of the Business Solutions sales team regarding phoenixNAP cloud products when time allows.

• Understand the marketplace and continually review competitive products and offerings and work with the Vice President of Products regarding the phoenixNAP product mix.

Physical Requirements

• Ability to sit for long periods of time.

• Ability to type at a speed of at least 60 words per minute.

• Ability to use basic Microsoft Office Suite software.

• Ability to walk or stand for long periods of time at tradeshows.

Attendance Requirements

• This is a full time position. Employee is expected to work a minimum of 40 hours per week.

• The schedule is generally Monday - Friday 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

• Some travel to industry trade show may be required that will include overnight stays outside of the Phoenix marketplace.

• Sales Director will provide expected work hours and travel schedules.

Qualifications

• 5 - 7 years of business to business sales experience.

• 3 - 5 years of IT focused sales experience.

• Detailed training or experience with virtualization applications including VMWare, Citrix and open source solutions.

• Experience or training with Microsoft Office applications including Work, Excel & Power Point.

• Team focused attitude and a willingness to help other team members with technical information. regarding cloud and virtualization phoenixNAP products.

• Past experience or a detailed working understanding of SalesForce CRM software.

• Strong ability to manage their own time and schedule.

• Ability to maintain a opportunity pipeline and complete all sales process requirements.

• Ability to move prospects forward in the buying process and close opportunities.

• Strong work ethic focused on producing daily and weekly results.

• Understanding of individual prospecting including telephone, e-mail and social media skills.

• Excellent verbal communication skills.

• Excellent telephone communication and prospecting skills.

• A team focused attitude.

Compensation Includes

• FLSA: Exempt
• Medical Insurance
• Dental Insurance
• Vision Insurance
• $50,000 Life Insurance
• 401k

• Paid Time Off
• Discounted gym membership
• Company sponsored outings

items.content:
Instructor, Professional Programs at Kaplan

Remote

Location: Remote/Nationwide Remote/Nationwide USA

Part-time instructors are responsible for teaching live online and/or in-person courses for engineering licensure exam preparation. These individuals serve as subject matter experts and student advocates while delivering exceptional experiences to students.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Demonstrate excellent teaching skills and ability to engage students in the classroom while providing a strong focus on mentoring and driving student success.
  • Serve as an industry and exam expert in areas of study.
  • Run class time schedule in accordance with the established itinerary.
  • Respond to student questions, emails, and forum posts through the established end date of the Program. Responses will be diplomatically and supportively phrased and posted within forty-eight (48) hours of receipt of the question. Forum posts must include a welcome message on or before the Program start date.
  • Prior to the Program start date, thoroughly review all course materials to ensure technical accuracy, submit any errors/improvements, and be confident/prepared to teach.
  • Submit errors, revisions, or improvements at least once per week throughout the Program duration. If no submission is necessary, Instructor must acknowledge that no revisions are being submitted.
  • Review and update online grade book at least once per week, until one week after the established end date of the Program.
  • Ensure all live webinar technical requirements are met. This includes, but is not limited to, logging in early to the live sessions, ensuring the recording starts/stops, meeting minimal software/hardware/Internet requirements, delivering sessions in a quiet environment, and posting recordings for students.
  • Upload provided presentation slides to live course classrooms. If ancillary documents are presented by Instructor during the course, Instructor is to also upload these for students.
  • Adjust teaching style based on feedback and constructive criticism.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor Degree in Engineering
  • 2+ Years’ prior teaching experience. Previous employment in the Engineering industry with detailed knowledge of licensing exam content and preparation.
  • FE and PE Licenses
  • Microsoft Office Suite knowledge
  • Ability to effectively utilize online classroom technology
  • Ability to follow processes
  • Dynamic speaking ability
  • Attention to detail; Urgency

items.content:
SAP Project Manager with technical SAP project experience (upgrades/migrations) is required by our client, a market leading "SAP on the AWS Cloud" frontrunner

Based working from a home office, The SAP Project Manager will take overall responsibility for the successful delivery of SAP on AWS Cloud migrations and implementations to the highest standards, of a project or portfolio of projects. He/she will be expected to co-ordinate and manage client teams to successfully deliver projects ensuring that agreed tools, methodologies and automation tools are utilised effectively

The Project Manager will be able to operate independently calling on support when required, and ensuring that risks and issues and identified and mitigated or escalated as appropriate; and opportunities are identified and pursued

Responsibilities

  • Take full responsibility for the leadership and management of all SAP functional and technical work streams ensuring that all personnel understand their roles and requirements to ensure successful programme roll out.
  • Responsible for all project planning and control as well as progress reporting to stakeholders.
  • Risk and issue management as well as effective budget management.
  • Oversee and drive change management and be a custodian of continuous improvement regarding programme and project delivery.
  • To identify and have a good working relationship with all stakeholders and business users involved within the various projects.
  • To support and coach team members through the programme and project processes.
  • Line management responsibilities for the SAP project resource team.
  • Overseeing and supporting the wider Project Managers, with quality gate processes to ensure that deliverables and the projects stay on track and to budget ensuring business goals are met.

Required Attributes (Essential)

  • Previous proven SAP Project delivery experience gained working for a consulting organisation
  • Able to work from home at least 50% of the time with some travel
  • Understands when and how to escalate and mitigate
  • Self motivator and self starter
  • Inquisitive, wanting to learn

items.title: 100% Remote- Training Lead/Project Manager/Process Analyst
items.content:
Genesis10, , is seeking a Training Lead/Project Manager for a contract position with our client in Hopkins, MN. Candidate can be located anywhere in US - REMOTE position.

Must have experience with global import/export processes.

Summary:
The Training Lead will work in partnership with the Process Lead to identify training gaps and ensure effective training delivery to Latin American teams on new business processes for import/export operations. 90% of this job and communication will be in Spanish.

Responsibilities:
* Work with the Program Manager and Fulfillment Team to develop a workforce transition and knowledge transfer approaches to mitigate impact to business as usual and to prepare for a global operations transition go-live. Oversee the delivery of effective training of Latin American teams on new import/export processes, roles & responsibilities to improve effectiveness and mitigate fraud risks.
* Work closely with the Latin American Process Lead to understand new, future state business processes, roles & responsibilities.
* Identified training needs including content and user groups needing training.
* Develop training content.
* Deliver onsite training to teams located in South & Central American locations
* training content aligns to the future state processes & roles.
* Manage the overall training workstream for the Latin American portion of the overall program
* Apply organizational change management principles; create business cases and communicate the value propositions to teams and leaders being trained on the 'why's' for the training and new processes and roles and how it aligns to the overall business strategy.
* Oversee knowledge transfer and onboarding processes and keep Global Program stakeholders informed of progress toward go-.live readiness
* Identify and assess future and current training needs through job analysis, career paths and consultation with leadership
* Monitor and evaluate training program's effectiveness, success and ROI periodically and report on them
* Manage project plan, budget, resources, tasks, schedules, issues/risks and status
* Resolve any specific problems and tailor training programs as necessary

Qualifications:
* BS degree in education, human resources or relevant field
* Fluent Spanish speaker, expert-level verbal & written Spanish
* Able to travel up to 75% to South & Central America
* 5-10 years in Corporate Training including: content development, curriculum design, training planning, training facilitation, assessment & reporting of training effectiveness
* Strong Project/ Management
* Must have current, valid passport
* Excellent communication and leadership skills
* Ability to plan, multi-task and manage time effectively

If you have the described qualifications and are interested in this exciting opportunity, apply today!

Genesis10 provides access to career opportunities with over 40 clients in the Twin Cities. As the #3 ranked firm for Business and IT consulting in Minnesota, we offer a variety of opportunities whether you are looking for contract, contract-to-hire, or permanent positions. Let's connect today!

Benefits of Working with Genesis10:
* Medical and dental insurance available- including HSA
* Bi-weekly payroll
* Established consultant re-marketing program with our 50+ local clients!
* 401k plan
* Downtown Minneapolis/St. Paul parking allowance
* Delivery Director for employee success and support
* Referral program with the opportunity to earn additional income

About Genesis10:
Genesis10 is a Professional Technology Services Firm providing Staffing, Workforce Optimization and Domestic Outsourcing Solutions. If you are a high performing business or IT professional with solid, referenced experience, we want to meet you. Genesis10 recruiters and delivery professionals are highly accomplished career advocates, who get to know you beyond your resume to position you with the opportunities that fit your skills, experience and aspirations. We have benefit options to fit your needs and a support staff that works with you from placement throughout your engagement - project after project. To learn more about Genesis10 and to view all our available career opportunities, please visit us at "Genesis10 is an Equal Opportunity Employer, M/F/D/V"

items.title: Customer Delight Executive (high growth startup) MB0042 Moneybox – London SE1
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=6, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
*About Moneybox*

A generation is growing up without the tools or information they need to confidently build their financial future.

Whether the next goal is getting on the property ladder, starting their own business or paying for the big day, they are not being supported effectively by current providers.

For many, the concept of ‘wealth’ seems alien; it seems both too general and something only other people have.

That’s because there isn’t enough help available;

* the ‘wealth management’ industry is set up for those who already have wealth, not those who need to build it.
* banks are focused on selling products rather than helping people to achieve financial outcomes.
* financial planning is not taught at school or at work.

All of this means people don’t know where to start, taking part feels alien and unachievable everything seems very complicated

*Our ambition is to help a generation invest in their future.*

* Moneybox is on a mission to change the way people save and invest toward their future. Forget old-school finance - we make saving and investing part of your everyday life and help you achieve your goals, be it buying a house, saving for your children or something much more frivolous!
* Moneybox enables you to invest the change from your everyday purchases into simple tracker funds. For example, when you buy your morning coffee for £2.40, you can invest the 60p change into tracker funds within your ISA. This means that a you can set money aside to invest before you’ve finished your breakfast – not a bad start to the day!
* We have won multiple awards, and are currently one of the fastest growing fintech apps in the UK.
* We were founded in July 2015 by serial entrepreneurs Ben Stanway and Charlie Mortimer and currently have a team of 30. We expect to double this in the next year.
* We are authorised and regulated by the FCA and are backed by some of the UK’s leading venture capital investors.


*Job Brief*

We are currently growing at a rapid pace with more and more people using Moneybox. To support this exciting growth, we’re looking for someone to join our Customer Delight team and ensure that Moneybox continues to be known for taking pride in ‘delighting’ both existing and potential customers. We want to go above and beyond wherever we can and ensure that using the service is a great experience.

Working days: Five days per week which will include one weekend day (where you can work from home).


*What You’ll Do*

* Interact with current and potential customers through Intercom to address any queries they have.
* Collaborate with the Operations and Compliance team to ensure a great customer experience.
* Work with the Product team to continually improve the customer experience.
* Look for ways to go ‘above and beyond’ to make customers happy.
* Ad-hoc projects.


*What we’re looking for*

* A driven, ambitious individual who’s looking to build their career at an exciting very- fast-growing company.
* Naturally personable, great communicator who has a passion for their work and the people they work with
* Excited about being part of a fast-growing company that’s trying to make a positive mark on the world
* Knows have to have fun whilst maintaining a professional outlook


*Experience and Skills*

* Excellent written and spoken English
* Ability to work well both individually and as part of a team
* Good analytical and problem solving skills
* A ‘high-output do-er’ with a desire to work in a fast-paced, fast-changing start up environment

Bonus points for:

* Explaining clearly in introduction email why you think Moneybox is exciting and why you believe you are a great candidate.
* Direct experience with Intercom or similar customer service platforms.


*What’s in it for you?*

* Opportunity to join a fast-growing, award-winning and super ambitious startup
* Work with a friendly team of highly motivated individuals
* Be in an environment where you are listened to and can actually have an impact
* Thriving collaborative and inclusive company culture
* Competitive remuneration package
* Potential for company share options
* 25 days holiday + bank holidays

Our office is in London, by the Oxo Tower


PEASE NOTE:

By sending us your application you acknowledge and agree to Moneybox using your personal data as described below. We collect applicants’ personal data to manage our recruitment related activities. Consequently, we may use your personal data to evaluate your application, to select and shortlist applicants, to set up and conduct interviews and tests, to evaluate and assess the results, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment process generally.

We do not share your personal data with unauthorised third parties. However, we may, if necessary, share your personal data to carefully selected third parties acting on our behalf. This may include transfers to servers and databases outside the country where you provided us with your personal data. Such transfers may include for example transfers and/or disclosures outside the European Economic Area and in the United States of America.

If you are unsuccessful in your application, we may keep your details on file so that we can tell you about other suitable vacancies which may be of interest to you when they arise in the future. If you would rather we did not keep your details on file, you can contact us at email: jobs(at)moneyboxapp.com

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Director Of Engineering


Auth0


Auth0, a global leader in Identity-as-a-Service (IDaaS), provides thousands of enterprise customers with a Universal Identity Platform for their web, mobile, IoT, and internal applications. Our extensible platform seamlessly authenticates and secures more than 1.5B logins per month, making it loved by developers and trusted by global enterprises. Auth0 has raised more than $110 million to date and is continuing its global growth at a rapid pace. We are consistently recognized as a great place to work based our outstanding leadership and dedication to company culture, and are looking for the best people to join our incredible team spread across more than 35 countries!

Due to explosive growth Auth0 is seeking a Director of Engineering to help lead and scale our software development and innovation efforts to deliver the most advanced authentication and authorization SaaS on the market. This is a full time technical leadership role overseeing the growth of our highly productive teams of smart and engaged engineers. Successful candidates will be located on the west coast in PST (UTC−8 or within 3 hours) OR London metro area (UTC+1).

Auth0 has been remote-first since inception and fully embraces a remote workstyle. VP’s and C level execs work remote and we have the tools and resources in-place to ensure success. Not only are we looking for a talented Engineering leader, we are looking for someone who will contribute to our culture.

You will:


* Work closely with our Team Leads, Engineering Directors and VP of Engineering to help scale our Engineering Organization to meet our customer and product needs.

* Lead, mentor and coach a mix of new and seasoned engineering managers running widely distributed teams.

* Work closely with Product & Design to build the next generation of Identity products.

* Provide operational excellence and implement processes and policies that create efficiencies during a time of massive growth.

* Maintain our high security, performance and availability SLA’s as we rapidly scale for customers with 100M+ monthly active users.

* Lead teams that continuously ship product improvements, measures the results, and iterateHelp convert our systems to be service based and cloud agnostic.

* Define and execute engineering and company wide OKR’s.




About you:


* You have experienced high-growth in a short period of time and are comfortable with putting systems in place and adjusting and adapting when needed.

* You are comfortable leading and managing widely distributed teams (Geography and Time).  This is core to our culture and even our VP of Engineering is remote.

* You care about culture and values and like to be a steward for values such as transparency, collaboration, inclusiveness, accountability and experimentation.

* You have experience managing, coaching and growing other engineering managers and team leads. We have a strong culture of promoting from within so we are looking for someone who is comfortable grooming first-time managers.

* You set clear goals and clear expectations for your team. Your goal is to to empower your teams to make decisions and your managers to one day do your job.  

* You work closely with your peer organizations to ensure cross-team collaboration is effective.

* You have outstanding communication and presentation skills including the ability to effectively interface with business, executive, and technical teams.

* You have built and scaled distributed systems on public clouds (Amazon, Azure, GCP, etc.).

* You are open about technology choices, and like to contribute to OSS projects. Our current stack focuses on Node, ElasticSearch, MongoDB, and React but we focus on picking the right tools for the job.

* You have experience allocating and deploying resources across teams and managing to a budget.

* You are located in PST (UTC−8 or within 3 hours) OR London, UK metro area (UTC+1).

* You ideally have experience in the identity and access management (IAM) domain (not required).




Auth0 fosters an inclusive workplace free from discrimination. Auth0 is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Auth0 conducts all employment-related activities without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, genetics, or status as a Vietnam-era special disabled and other covered veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Auth0 participates in E-Verify and will confirm work authorization for candidates residing in the United States.

See more jobs at Auth0

items.title: Travis CI GmbH: Engineering Manager
items.content:
Engineering Manager

Company: Travis CI GmbH
Headquarters: Berlin
https://travisci.workable.com/jobs/793429
Description

Travis CI is looking for an engineering manager to join our engineering team. Engineering managers help our developers stay focused, organize their work, and keep track of progress on project and company goals.

The main goal of an engineering manager is a healthy and effective team. This involves developing and implementing software development processes and frameworks with the team, facilitating team communication, and supporting developers’ professional growth.

Requirements

We are looking for candidates with 4+ years of experience of engineering management or equivalent experience. Experience with remote and widely distributed teams is preferred. We welcome and encourage people from diverse backgrounds to apply. Travis CI seeks to increase the ratio of women in software engineering and development, and we especially encourage women and people from underrepresented (underestimated!) groups to apply for this position.

Team Focus


  • Help developers organize and plan their work, and track team progress on development project goals.
  • Remove roadblocks holding up the team’s or individual member’s progress.
  • Plan and help manage the development team schedule; balancing the company’s needs with the individuals’ preferences for work schedule.
  • Have an architectural overview of our systems and discuss technical decisions with your team; encourage quality in engineering to maintain and improve the reliability of our product.
  • Participate in code reviews and occasionally do hands-on development work like pair-programming.
  • Help manage our support and on-call rotations.

Communication


  • Ensure communication between developers and other departments (especially Product, Creative, and Customer Support) is bi-directional and effective for building required deliverables and developer satisfaction.
  • Implement and manage tools that increase visibility of developer work.
  • Participate in planning sessions with product management.
  • Help to improve remote collaboration within our distributed team.

Professional Growth


  • Hold 1:1 meetings that foster professional development and track progress on employee-specific goals.
  • Help employees to align personal career goals with company initiatives and needs.

About Travis CI


Travis CI is a continuous integration platform: We help developers test, integrate, and ship their code, increasing the confidence, reliability, and speed of their development process.
We strive to give back to the open source software (OSS) community. 95% of our code is open source, and we expect our builders to understand the tools, ethos, and benefits of a strong open source community. Travis CI is run as a hosted service, free for open source, and a paid product for private code. We also have an on-site offering for large enterprises who prefer to use their own infrastructure to run Travis CI (Travis CI Enterprise).

We are a growing, bootstrapped business headquartered in Berlin, Germany with a team distributed across the globe. Our goal is to help developers build better software. Travis CI is building a profitable, sustainable business for the long run.

Our core company values are openness, diversity, collaboration, and empathy. Travis CI strives to be a diverse team, made of and built by people with different backgrounds and lifestyles. We do not discriminate based on race, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, accessibility needs, age, religion, color, or any other group.


Benefits


Location/Travel: Being a distributed team, you can work from wherever you want
Flexible working hours: You choose your working hours. We understand life comes with responsibilities and complications, and we encourage all our employees to spend time tending to them.

Time-off: You will have a minimum of 25 days off - and you must take all of them, and at least two weeks together consecutively. We know things at work can be busy and exciting, but want to help make sure you are happy and healthy, and time away is important for that.

Health Benefits: Your health insurance is partially covered by Travis CI. We’ll cover 50% of your health insurance, up to €350 per month, no matter where you are.

Apply for this position

Send a resume here: https://travisci.workable.com/jobs/793429/candidates/new

Senior Developer with functional programming expertise (preferably Clojure)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Industry: Academic Research, Machine Learning, Publishing
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Knowledge E | Dubai, United Arab Emirates

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+03:00) Riyadh +/- 2 hours
Office Location: Dubai, United Arab Emirates. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Visa Sponsorship: Yes
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

functional-programming
clojure
machine-learning
bigdata
datomic

Job description

The Role

You’ll be a key driver for the development of our discovery service and be working alongside a small multi-disciplinary team including service design, backend and frontend developers and our QA team. The discovery service will eventually include 100+ million full-text articles that need to be indexed automatically to enable the end users an outstanding user experience for accessing research literature, including intelligent searches, advanced browsing through subject categories and get highly relevant recommendations on what to read and whom to collaborate with, based on their search and navigation behaviour on the platform.

To deliver excellent solutions, you should be able to think out of the box and pro-actively elaborate new creative solutions to the challenges researchers and students are facing. It is also important that you stay up-to-date with latest trends and technologies in related areas, like NLP, AI, Machine Learning and Big Data as well as within the research and publishing domain. 

You Are

Passionate about working with big data and making sense out of it for the end users by applying artificial intelligence and machine learning tools and techniques. 

Minimum Job Qualifications

  • Excellent programming skills to ensure elegant solutions with high performance, ideally with proficiency in at least one functional programming language such as Clojure (preferable).
  • Ability to work with handling large volumes of data, including parsing, ingestion and indexing 
  • Fluent in English

Desired Extras

  • University degree, for example in Computer Science
  • Experience with Datomic, Elastic search, Google's Knowledge Graph, NLP, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, ...
Apply now

About Knowledge E

At Knowledge E we’re a passionate team of 25+ hands-on entrepreneurs, engineers and research domain experts that want to make the lives of researchers a great deal easier and a bit more fun, and make as significant behind-the-scene-contributions as possible to advancing the research front to the benefit for all of us. We’re well funded through our existing content subscription-based business and grow steadily through new, dynamic research institutions turning to us for our more recent capacity-building training, publishing and discovery services.

The development team currently includes 8 members having roles ranging from Service Design & UX to System Architecture, Frontend & Backend development, Testing & Quality Assurance and Technical Support.

Benefits

  • International, agile and fun team to work with!
  • Flexible a generous vacation possibilities
  • 1 week free for charity work sponsored by Knowledge E Foundation
  • Regular team events & joint after-work activities
  • Select your own awesome hardware
